intro: Secamone micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and usually have five petals, with a distinctive yellow corona.
